intro: Piper cararense var. cararense, commonly known as the Carare pepper plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador. It is a climbing vine characterized by its dark green, ovate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that transition from green to red as they mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
